text: The 1977 San Francisco Giants season was the Giants' 95th season in Major League Baseball, their 20th season in San Francisco since their move from New York following the 1957 season, and their 18th at Candlestick Park. The team finished in fourth place in the National League West with a 75–87 record, 23 games behind the Los Angeles Dodgers. == Offseason == * October 20, 1976: Mike Caldwell, Dave Rader and John D'Acquisto were traded by the Giants to the St. Louis Cardinals for Willie Crawford, John Curtis and Vic Harris.Vic Harris at Baseball Reference * December 7, 1976: Jeff Yurak was drafted from the Giants by the Milwaukee Brewers in the 1976 minor league draft.Jeff Yurak at Baseball Reference * January 11, 1977: Bud Black was drafted by the Giants in the 3rd round of the 1977 Major League Baseball draft, but did not sign.Bud Black at Baseball Reference * February 11, 1977: Bobby Murcer, Steve Ontiveros, and Andy Muhlstock (minors) were traded by the Giants to the Chicago Cubs for Bill Madlock and Rob Sperring.Bill Madlock at Baseball Reference * March 26, 1977: Willie Crawford and Rob Sperring were traded by the Giants to the Houston Astros for Rob Andrews and cash.Rob Andrews at Baseball Reference * March 26, 1977: Chris Bourjos was signed as an amateur free agent by the Giants.Chris Bourjos at Baseball Reference * March 31, 1977: Ken Rudolph was purchased by the Giants from the St. Louis Cardinals.Ken Rudolph at Baseball Reference == Regular season == === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Opening Day starters === *Rob Andrews *Darrell Evans *Marc Hill *Bill Madlock *Willie McCovey *John Montefusco *Chris Speier *Gary Thomasson *Terry Whitfieldhttp://www.baseball-almanac.com/teamstats/roster.php?y=1977&t;=SFN === Notable transactions === * May 19, 1977: DeWayne Buice was signed as an amateur free agent by the Giants.DeWayne Buice at Baseball Reference * June 7, 1977: Chili Davis was drafted by the Giants in the 11th round of the 1977 Major League Baseball draft.
